text: <@UBS7QANF3>, I know that the bet execution report is obtained live. Is it possible to make the same conclusion using historical orders data? Ie, list_cleared_orders our list_cleared_orders (from btlw) ?

elements.text: , I know that the bet execution report is obtained live. Is it possible to make the same conclusion using historical orders data? Ie, list_cleared_orders our list_cleared_orders (from btlw) ?

text: No. I highly recommend scraping the order stream and/or saving the execution reports

attachments.text: Utility functions for working with Betfair data
attachments.title: mberk/betfairutil

elements.text: Hi everyone, just getting started with flumine. Wondering how can I feed the market data from bz2 files downloaded from betfair into it?
What exactly does the
markets

override accept?

is flumine capable of reading raw data as is or do I need to pre-process it by using e.g.

text:
1. Give the list of files in the `market_filter` under the `markets` key
2. Yes it can read the raw data files but you probably need to patch `open` as described here: <https://betcode-org.github.io/flumine/performance/#file-location>

elements.text: Give the list of files in the
market_filter
under the
markets
key
Yes it can read the raw data files but you probably need to patch
open
as described here:

text: That's very helpful, thanks

elements.text: That's very helpful, thanks

text:
*Context:* I'm trying to run a very simple strategy (always back the first runner at a certain level) on *basic* data (i.e. just last_price_traded without having access to order book depth). And my orders don't seem to ever get filled.
*Questions:*
• Is there anything that needs to be done to make orders get filled when backtesting on "basic" data?
• Is it even possible to get backtesting work on basic data? I'm fine with either assuming infinite depth at a certain level and/or some const value
• In basic data mode, if I place an order (back)  with "limit=X" 
    ◦ and currently the market (i.e. last traded price) is at A (A < X)
    ◦ the next mkt data tick provides last traded price is at B (A < X < B) -- *will my order get filled?*

In basic data mode, if I place an order (back)  with "limit=X"
and currently the market (i.e. last traded price) is at A (A < X)
the next mkt data tick provides last traded price is at B (A < X < B) --

text: Any tips for reducing number of conflated market messages?

elements.text: Any tips for reducing number of conflated market messages?

text: Hi guys, let's say I have 2 different orders standing in the market at same price. The second order was sent after few seconds of the first order. Now I want to cancel both the orders at the same time. Any way to do this?

elements.text: Hi guys, let's say I have 2 different orders standing in the market at same price. The second order was sent after few seconds of the first order. Now I want to cancel both the orders at the same time. Any way to do this?

text: increase the conflate parameter?

elements.text: increase the conflate parameter?

text:
<https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/cancelOrders>

cancelOrders takes a list of orders to cancel. Just store the betids of the orders u want to cancel

elements.text: cancelOrders takes a list of orders to cancel. Just store the betids of the orders u want to cancel

text: I’ve got it set to nil - I want as little conflation as possible, but still getting some

got it set to nil - I want as little conflation as possible, but still getting some

text: How can you tell you are getting more conflated than u should?

elements.text: How can you tell you are getting more conflated than u should?

text: Don't spend so much time handling the messages

elements.text: Don't spend so much time handling the messages

text:
does it allow partial cancellations
for instance, if my first two orders were of size 10 and 5, and now I want to cancel size 12, is it possible using cancelOrders?

elements.text:
does it allow partial cancellations
for instance, if my first two orders were of size 10 and 5, and now I want to cancel size 12, is it possible using cancelOrders?

text: Will there always be some conflated? I’ve benchmarked and don’t think there’s too much time spent handling messages, they get passed off to a different thread and are buffered

elements.text: Will there always be some conflated?
I’ve
benchmarked and
don’t
think
there’s
too much time spent handling messages, they get passed off to a different thread and are buffered

text: What is your definition of too much time spent?

elements.text: What is your definition of too much time spent?

text: Conflation happens when you are not pulling the data off the socket fast enough. By definition, if it's happening then you are spending too much time handling the data. Whether it matters or not is another question

elements.text: Conflation happens when you are not pulling the data off the socket fast enough. By definition, if it's happening then you are spending too much time handling the data. Whether it matters or not is another question

text: Time spent between socket reads is like 10 micros so I’m guessing something else is going on if that’s the only reason messages conflate

text:
looks like it is in some cases based on the docs linked above by AI Trader <https://docs.developer.betfair.com/display/1smk3cen4v3lu3yomq5qye0ni/Betting+Type+Definitions#BettingTypeDefinitions-CancelInstruction>

> `sizeReduction` `double` If supplied then this is a partial cancel. Should be set to 'null' if no size reduction is required.

sizeReduction
double
If supplied then this is a partial cancel. Should be set to 'null' if no size reduction is required.

text:
Hi #Flumine users,
Could someone explain why this is required?

```            if (
                order.bet_id and order.bet_id != current_order.bet_id
            ):  # replaceOrder handling (hacky)
                order = markets.get_order_from_bet_id(
                    market_id=current_order.market_id,
                    bet_id=current_order.bet_id,
                )```
<https://github.com/betcode-org/flumine/blob/796ec51060328edac7e14678c6defd63a964d250/flumine/order/process.py#L63>

elements.text:
Hi #Flumine users,
Could someone explain why this is required?

text: Not sure I understand the question, but I don't think you can cancel a size higher than the size of any individual order. I think in your example, you need to internally figure out that you need to cancel entirely the order of size 10 and partially cancel 3 USD out of the 5 USD of the second order.

elements.text: Not sure I understand the question, but I don't think you can cancel a size higher than the size of any individual order. I think in your example, you need to internally figure out that you need to cancel entirely the order of size 10 and partially cancel 3 USD out of the 5 USD of the second order.
